Name: Jar
Description: Pottery vase in the form of the ritual vessel for libations, used in the hieroglyphic script for the sound 'h+s'. The hes-vase has flat base, slender foot, convex body profile, a short narrow neck, and broad flat rim. This example has a more convex shoulder than the classic hes-vase. Margaret Murray recorded the surface as being covered with a red pigment. The vase was found in a tomb of the early Middle Kingdom, about 1900 BC.
